episodeTitle: Festival on the Night Before Gold Hunting! Feelings for 'Vearth!'
description: The Straw Hats prepare to locate the City of Gold after Nami makes a crucial discovery about the connection between Jaya and Skypiea. Gan Fall explains the significance of vearth (soil) to sky dwellers, while the crew celebrates with a campfire party alongside a pack of wolves. Meanwhile, the Shandia warriors resolve to reclaim their ancestral homeland of Upper Yard.

events.title: Shandia Warriors Retreat After Battle
events.description: The Shandia warrior tribe retreats from their battle in Upper Yard after Kamakiri sustains injuries while protecting his companion Raki from danger. Priest Ohm and his dog Holy briefly pursue them before being summoned by Enel.
events.significance: Shows the ongoing conflict between the Shandia and the priests of Skypiea, highlighting the warriors' dedication to protecting each other despite their determination to reclaim their homeland.

events.title: Straw Hats Gather Provisions for Cooking
events.description: The Straw Hat crew works together to collect provisions for their meal. Sanji prepares to cook stew using a heated rock as a makeshift stove, while Zoro, Chopper, and Robin search for ingredients in the surrounding area.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's teamwork and resourcefulness in adapting to their environment on Skypiea. Shows their ability to maintain normalcy and camaraderie even in dangerous situations.

events.title: Nami Discovers the Skull-Shaped Island Connection
events.description: Nami makes a crucial discovery by overlaying the maps of Jaya and Skypiea, revealing that when properly aligned, the two islands form a skull shape together. This proves that Upper Yard was originally part of Jaya before being blasted into the sky 400 years ago by the Knock Up Stream.
events.significance: This is a pivotal revelation that solves the mystery of Mont Blanc Noland's story and proves he wasn't a liar. It confirms the City of Gold truly existed and was sent skyward, validating Cricket's faith in his ancestor and providing the Straw Hats with a clear target for their search.

quotes.text: When you overlay the maps of Jaya and Skypiea, they form a skull shape! Upper Yard was part of Jaya 400 years ago!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Revealing her map discovery to the crew

events.title: Identification of the Skull's Right Eye as City of Gold Location
events.description: Based on Nami's skull-shaped map discovery and Mont Blanc Noland's riddle about 'the Skull's Right Eye,' the crew deduces the exact location where the City of Gold should be in Upper Yard. This provides them with a specific target for their expedition the following day.
events.significance: Solves the 400-year-old mystery of Noland's cryptic message and gives the Straw Hats a clear objective. This moment represents the convergence of Cricket's quest, Noland's legacy, and the crew's adventure, all pointing to the same location.

quotes.text: The Skull's Right Eye - that must be where the City of Gold is located!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Connecting Noland's riddle to the map discovery

events.title: Gan Fall Explains the Concept of Vearth
events.description: Gan Fall, the Knight of the Sky, explains to the Straw Hats that sky islanders refer to soil as 'vearth' - a sacred and precious substance because soil cannot naturally occur in their cloud-based environment. He reveals why the Shandia treasure small bags of vearth and why Upper Yard is considered holy land.
events.significance: This explanation provides crucial context for understanding the 400-year war between Skypieans and Shandia. It shows that what seems ordinary to the Straw Hats (dirt) is literally sacred to sky dwellers, explaining the intense conflict over Upper Yard.

quotes.text: We sky dwellers call soil 'vearth.' It's sacred to us because soil cannot exist naturally in the sky. That's why Upper Yard, with its abundant vearth, is considered holy land.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining the significance of vearth to the Straw Hats

events.title: Confrontation with the Wolf Pack
events.description: Luffy, Usopp, Zoro, and Sanji decide to have a campfire when they are confronted by a pack of wolves who believe the Straw Hats are invading their territory. The wolves threaten the crew until Nami punches the pack leader, settling the misunderstanding.
events.significance: Provides comedic relief while demonstrating Nami's authority within the crew. The encounter sets up the celebratory campfire party and shows how the Straw Hats can turn potential conflicts into friendships.

events.title: Eve of Gold Festival Campfire Party
events.description: After resolving the misunderstanding with the wolves, the Straw Hats light a campfire and celebrate an 'Eve of Gold Festival' party. The crew dances around the fire with the pack of wolves, accompanied by the song 'Family' (Oretachi wa Family), creating a joyful moment before their dangerous expedition.
events.significance: This party embodies the Straw Hats' spirit of finding joy and camaraderie even in dangerous situations. The 'Family' song emphasizes the found-family theme central to One Piece, showing how the crew has become a true family unit. It also demonstrates their ability to befriend even wild animals.

events.title: Shandia Warriors Resolve to Reclaim Upper Yard
events.description: The Shandia warriors, including Wyper, gather and resolve their internal conflicts. They commit to returning to Upper Yard to finish their fight against Enel and the priests, determined to finally reclaim their ancestral homeland after 400 years of exile.
events.significance: Establishes the Shandia's unwavering determination and sets up the coming battles. Their resolve mirrors the Straw Hats' own determination, showing parallel quests for different reasons - one for treasure, one for homeland.

quotes.text: If we defeat Enel, there will no longer be any need to cherish a small bag of vearth. We can finally return home.
quotes.speaker: Kamakiri
quotes.context: Expressing determination to reclaim their homeland despite his injuries

events.title: Crew Prepares for Gold Hunting Expedition
events.description: As the episode concludes, the Straw Hats make their final preparations for the expedition to find the City of Gold at the Skull's Right Eye location. Usopp prepares to fix the ship, Nami finalizes the navigation plan, and the crew readies themselves for the dangerous journey ahead.
events.significance: Sets up the events of the following episodes where the crew will venture into the heart of Upper Yard to locate Shandora, the City of Gold. Their preparation shows they're taking the mission seriously despite their festive celebration.

quotes.text: When you overlay the maps of Jaya and Skypiea, they form a skull shape! Upper Yard was part of Jaya 400 years ago!
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: The Skull's Right Eye - that must be where the City of Gold is located!
quotes.speaker: Nami
quotes.context: Connecting Noland's riddle to the map

quotes.text: We sky dwellers call soil 'vearth.' It's sacred to us because soil cannot exist naturally in the sky. That's why Upper Yard, with its abundant vearth, is considered holy land.
quotes.speaker: Gan Fall
quotes.context: Explaining vearth to the Straw Hats

quotes.text: If we defeat Enel, there will no longer be any need to cherish a small bag of vearth. We can finally return home.
quotes.speaker: Kamakiri
quotes.context: Expressing Shandia determination to reclaim Upper Yard

themes.description: The episode explores the deep connection between people and their ancestral lands through both the Shandia's 400-year quest to reclaim Upper Yard and the revelation about the City of Gold's origins. The concept of vearth represents how precious one's homeland truly is.
themes.symbolism: Vearth (soil) symbolizes homeland and roots - what's ordinary to some is sacred to those who lack it. The small bags of vearth the Shandia cherish represent their connection to a home they've never known but refuse to abandon.
culturalReferences: The Shandia's struggle parallels real-world indigenous peoples' fights to reclaim ancestral lands

themes.description: The campfire party with the 'Family' song emphasizes the found-family dynamic of the Straw Hats. Even wild wolves join their celebration, showing how the crew creates bonds wherever they go.
themes.symbolism: The campfire represents warmth, safety, and togetherness. Dancing with wolves shows the Straw Hats' ability to turn strangers into friends and create family bonds beyond traditional definitions.
culturalReferences: The 'Family' song emphasizes the Japanese concept of nakama (bonds beyond friendship)

themes.description: Nami's discovery validates Mont Blanc Noland's story and Cricket's faith, proving that pursuing truth can vindicate those wrongly labeled as liars. The episode shows how uncovering historical truth matters to the present.
themes.symbolism: The skull-shaped island represents the hidden truth that only becomes visible when you look at the full picture. Noland's riddle symbolizes how truth can be preserved across generations through cryptic messages.

themes.description: Despite being in enemy territory facing powerful opponents, the Straw Hats take time to celebrate and enjoy themselves. This reflects their philosophy of living fully in the moment and maintaining joy even in danger.
themes.symbolism: The 'Eve of Gold Festival' represents the crew's ability to create their own traditions and celebrations, refusing to let danger diminish their spirit.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami demonstrates her exceptional navigation skills and analytical thinking by discovering the skull-shaped island connection. Her map analysis solves a 400-year-old mystery and proves essential to the crew's success. She also shows her authority by resolving the wolf confrontation with a single punch.
keyActions: Overlays maps of Jaya and Skypiea to discover skull shape
Identifies the Skull's Right Eye location for City of Gold
Punches wolf pack leader to resolve confrontation
Finalizes navigation plan for gold hunting expedition
quotes: When you overlay the maps of Jaya and Skypiea, they form a skull shape! Upper Yard was part of Jaya 400 years ago!
The Skull's Right Eye - that must be where the City of Gold is located!

characterSpotlights.development: Gan Fall serves as a bridge between the Straw Hats and Skypiean culture, explaining the sacred significance of vearth and providing crucial context for understanding the 400-year conflict. His explanations help the crew understand the deeper meaning behind the war for Upper Yard.
keyActions: Explains the concept and sacred nature of vearth
Provides historical context about Upper Yard's significance
quotes: We sky dwellers call soil 'vearth.' It's sacred to us because soil cannot exist naturally in the sky. That's why Upper Yard, with its abundant vearth, is considered holy land.

characterSpotlights.development: Despite being injured while protecting Raki, Kamakiri demonstrates the Shandia's unwavering determination to reclaim their homeland. His willingness to continue fighting despite injury shows the depth of the Shandia's commitment to their cause.
keyActions: Protects Raki from danger, sustaining injuries
Expresses determination to defeat Enel and reclaim homeland
quotes: If we defeat Enel, there will no longer be any need to cherish a small bag of vearth. We can finally return home.

characterSpotlights.development: Wyper leads the Shandia warriors in resolving their internal conflicts and renewing their commitment to reclaiming Upper Yard. His leadership brings unity to the warriors as they prepare for their final assault.
keyActions: Commits warriors to final battle for Upper Yard

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the campfire party sequence with the wolves, adding the 'Family' song performance which wasn't in the original manga chapter.
The anime adds more visual detail to Nami's map discovery scene, showing animated overlays of the two islands forming the skull shape more clearly than the manga's static panels.
The anime provides additional dialogue from Gan Fall about vearth and its cultural significance, expanding on the manga's briefer explanation.

trivia.fact: This episode features the song 'Family' (Oretachi wa Family), sung by the Straw Hat Pirates' voice actors. The song became so popular it was later re-recorded when Nico Robin officially joined the crew.

The skull-shaped island formed by Jaya and Upper Yard is one of the most important geographical revelations in One Piece, connecting multiple story arcs and proving Mont Blanc Noland's account from 400 years earlier.
This episode adapts Chapter 253 of the manga, titled 'Vearth,' which focuses on the cultural significance of soil to the sky islanders.
The concept of vearth (soil being sacred in the sky) is a unique worldbuilding element that adds depth to the Skypiea conflict, making it about more than just treasure or territory.
The episode's eyecatcher features Zoro and Sanji, continuing the series' tradition of showcasing different character pairs in these transitional segments.

The Japanese title '黄金前夜祭！「ヴァース」への想い！' (Ōgon Zenya Sai! 'Vāsu' e no Omoi!) literally translates to 'Eve of Gold Festival! Feelings for Vearth!' using the katakana transcription for the made-up word 'vearth.'
